You said: copare the calibration grid and output corrected text, it doesn't look like the fourier correction is boing applied to each word seperatly? explain? ChatGPT said: What you’re seeing is correct—each word is being distorted by the Fourier‐interpolated field, but because the field is a single, smooth global correction map, neighboring words end up shifting in very similar ways. In other words, we Calibrate once on the Amsler grid → build one global 2D Fourier displacement field. Apply that same field to every pixel of every word—so each word “feels” the same warp pattern, just at a different canvas location. That makes the corrected words all shift according to the same underlying map, so visually the warping can look almost uniform across words. If you actually want each word to be “re‐centered” and corrected around its own midpoint, you have two options: Recompute the Fourier map per word Treat each word’s center as the new “origin” for the interpolation. You’d need to recalculate computeCoeffs() so that the phase reference in the DFT is shifted to that word’s center before warping it. Translate coordinates before warping Offset your calls to fourierDist(x,y) by subtracting the word’s center, then add it back when drawing: js CopyEdit // inside your per-word loop: const {dx, dy} = fourierDist(xCanvas - wordCenterX + gridCenter, yCanvas - wordCenterY + gridCenter); This effectively “recenters” the correction field for that word. Why we originally did a single global map Simplicity: Only one calibration run, one DFT, one set of coefficients → lighter CPU cost. Continuity: Amsler-based distortion is measured across the whole central field and is inherently a smooth warp. But if your goal is to see each word snap individually back to its own perfect shape—regardless of its position—then you’ll need to apply one of the two strategies above so that each word’s deformation is computed with its own focal center. Let me know which approach you’d like to pursue and I can help adjust the code! You said: with its own focal center lets try this/ ChatGPT said: Thought for 4 seconds Edited Amsler Grid App I’ve updated the correction loop so that for each word we: Compute the pixel’s offset relative to that word’s center. Recenter those offsets onto the global Fourier grid’s center before sampling the distortion (fourierDist(sampleX, sampleY)). Apply the returned dx, dy to that word’s pixels. This effectively treats each word as if it were individually centered for the warp. Give it a try and see how each word now snaps back around its own focal point! <!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<title>Macular Vision Corrector</title>
<style>
body { display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; font-family: sans-serif; margin: 0; padding: 0; }
#controls { margin: 20px; display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 8px; }
.canvas-container { display: flex; gap: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px; }
canvas { border: 1px solid #888; }
button, label, textarea, input { font-size: 14px; }
</style>
</head>
<body>
<h2>Macular Vision Corrector</h2>
<div id="controls">
<button id="resetBtn">Reset Grid</button>
<button id="exportBtn">Export Displacements</button>
<input type="file" id="importInput" accept="application/json" style="display:none;">
<button id="importBtn">Import Displacements</button>
<label>Magnification: <input type="range" id="zoomSlider" min="1" max="3" step="0.1" value="1"><span id="zoomValue">1×</span></label>
<textarea id="textInput" rows="3" cols="50" placeholder="Enter your text here...">Sample Text for AMD Correction</textarea>
<button id="applyBtn">Apply My Correction</button>
</div>

<div class="canvas-container">
<div>
<h4>Calibration Grid</h4>
<canvas id="gridCanvas" width="400" height="400"></canvas>
</div>
<div>
<h4>Corrected Text Preview</h4>
<canvas id="previewCanvas" width="400" height="200"></canvas>
</div>
</div>

<script>
// Element refs
const gridCanvas = document.getElementById('gridCanvas'), gctx = gridCanvas.getContext('2d');
const previewCanvas = document.getElementById('previewCanvas'), pctx = previewCanvas.getContext('2d');
const zoomSlider = document.getElementById('zoomSlider'), zoomValue = document.getElementById('zoomValue');
const textInput = document.getElementById('textInput'), applyBtn = document.getElementById('applyBtn');
const resetBtn = document.getElementById('resetBtn'), exportBtn = document.getElementById('exportBtn');
const importBtn = document.getElementById('importBtn'), importInput = document.getElementById('importInput');

// Grid parameters
const COLS=20, ROWS=20, N=COLS+1;
const cellW=gridCanvas.width/COLS, cellH=gridCanvas.height/ROWS;
const FONT='20px sans-serif', lineHeight=24;
let points=[], dragPoint=null, coeffDx=[], coeffDy=[];

// Initialize grid points
for(let i=0;i<N;i++){
points[i]=[];
for(let j=0;j<N;j++){
points[i][j]={x:i*cellW,y:j*cellH,dx:0,dy:0};
}
}

// Draw grid function
function drawGrid(){
gctx.clearRect(0,0,gridCanvas.width,gridCanvas.height);
gctx.strokeStyle='#ccc'; gctx.lineWidth=1;
// vertical lines
for(let i=0;i<N;i++){
gctx.beginPath(); gctx.moveTo(points[i][0].x+points[i][0].dx,points[i][0].y+points[i][0].dy);
for(let j=1;j<N;j++) gctx.lineTo(points[i][j].x+points[i][j].dx,points[i][j].y+points[i][j].dy);
gctx.stroke();
}
// horizontal lines
for(let j=0;j<N;j++){
gctx.beginPath(); gctx.moveTo(points[0][j].x+points[0][j].dx,points[0][j].y+points[0][j].dy);
for(let i=1;i<N;i++) gctx.lineTo(points[i][j].x+points[i][j].dx,points[i][j].y+points[i][j].dy);
gctx.stroke();
}
// draggable handles
points.flat().forEach(p=>{
gctx.beginPath(); gctx.arc(p.x+p.dx,p.y+p.dy,4,0,2*Math.PI);
gctx.fillStyle='#333'; gctx.fill();
});
// center marker
const cx=gridCanvas.width/2, cy=gridCanvas.height/2;
gctx.strokeStyle='red'; gctx.lineWidth=2;
gctx.beginPath(); gctx.arc(cx,cy,6,0,2*Math.PI); gctx.stroke();
gctx.beginPath(); gctx.moveTo(cx-10,cy); gctx.lineTo(cx+10,cy);
gctx.moveTo(cx,cy-10); gctx.lineTo(cx,cy+10);
gctx.stroke();
}

// Mouse drag events
gridCanvas.addEventListener('pointerdown',e=>{
const r=gridCanvas.getBoundingClientRect();
const mx=e.clientX-r.left, my=e.clientY-r.top;
points.flat().forEach(p=>{
if(Math.hypot(mx-(p.x+p.dx),my-(p.y+p.dy))<8) dragPoint=p;
});
});
gridCanvas.addEventListener('pointermove',e=>{
if(!dragPoint) return;
const r=gridCanvas.getBoundingClientRect();
const mx=e.clientX-r.left, my=e.clientY-r.top;
dragPoint.dx=Math.max(-dragPoint.x,Math.min(gridCanvas.width-dragPoint.x,mx-dragPoint.x));
dragPoint.dy=Math.max(-dragPoint.y,Math.min(gridCanvas.height-dragPoint.y,my-dragPoint.y));
drawGrid();
});
gridCanvas.addEventListener('pointerup',()=>dragPoint=null);

// Fourier coefficient computation
function computeCoeffs(){
for(let u=0;u<N;u++){
coeffDx[u]=[]; coeffDy[u]=[];
for(let v=0;v<N;v++){
let rX=0,iX=0,rY=0,iY=0;
for(let i=0;i<N;i++) for(let j=0;j<N;j++){
const ang=-2*Math.PI*(u*i/N+v*j/N), c=Math.cos(ang), s=Math.sin(ang);
rX+=points[i][j].dx*c; iX+=points[i][j].dx*s;
rY+=points[i][j].dy*c; iY+=points[i][j].dy*s;
}
const norm=N*N;
coeffDx[u][v]={re:rX/norm,im:iX/norm};
coeffDy[u][v]={re:rY/norm,im:iY/norm};
}
}
}
// Sample distortion
function fourierDist(x,y){
const gx=x/cellW, gy=y/cellH; let dx=0, dy=0;
for(let u=0;u<N;u++) for(let v=0;v<N;v++){
const ang=2*Math.PI*(u*gx/N+v*gy/N), c=Math.cos(ang), s=Math.sin(ang);
dx+=coeffDx[u][v].re*c-coeffDx[u][v].im*s;
dy+=coeffDy[u][v].re*c-coeffDy[u][v].im*s;
}
return {dx,dy};
}

// Apply correction
applyBtn.onclick=()=>{
computeCoeffs();
pctx.clearRect(0,0,previewCanvas.width,previewCanvas.height);
pctx.font=FONT; pctx.textBaseline='top'; pctx.textAlign='left';
const words=textInput.value.trim().split(/\s+/).filter(w=>w.length);
const space=pctx.measureText(' ').width;
let x=0,y=0, maxW=previewCanvas.width;
// original text gray
pctx.fillStyle='rgba(0,0,0,0.2)';
words.forEach(w=>{
const wW=pctx.measureText(w).width;
if(x+wW>maxW){ x=0; y+=lineHeight; }
pctx.fillText(w,x,y); x+=wW+space;
});
// corrected black
x=0; y=0; pctx.fillStyle='#000';
words.forEach(w=>{
const wW=Math.ceil(pctx.measureText(w).width), h=lineHeight;
if(x+wW>maxW){ x=0; y+=lineHeight; }
const off=document.createElement('canvas'); off.width=wW; off.height=h;
const ictx=off.getContext('2d'); ictx.font=FONT; ictx.textBaseline='top'; ictx.fillStyle='#000';
ictx.fillText(w,0,0);
const src=ictx.getImageData(0,0,wW,h).data;
const dst=pctx.createImageData(wW,h);
const cx=previewCanvas.width/2, cy=previewCanvas.height/2;
for(let py=0;py<h;py++)for(let px=0;px<wW;px++){
const {dx,dy}=fourierDist(cx+px-wW/2, cy+py-h/2);
const sx=Math.round(px+dx), sy=Math.round(py+dy);
const si=4*((Math.max(0,Math.min(h-1,sy))*wW)+Math.max(0,Math.min(wW-1,sx)));
const di=4*((py*wW)+px);
dst.data.set(src.slice(si,si+4),di);
